TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowItemsPresenter extends System.Windows.Controls.ContentControl implements class System.Activities.Presentation.ICompositeView, class System.Activities.Presentation.IMultipleDragEnabledCompositeView

Docs.summary: Represents a control that can be used to present a collection of objects on a design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WorkflowItemsPresenter is the second key [!INCLUDE[avalon1](~/add/includes/avalon1-md.md)] control provided by the [!INCLUDE[wf2](~/add/includes/wf2-md.md)] designer infrastructure that is collection based. While the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowItemPresenter> enables the display and the editing of a single contained element, the WorkflowItemsPresenter is collection based, displays a visualization, and supports editing of the collection of items provided by the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowItemsPresenter.Items%2A> property. In addition to allowing the multiple items contained in the collection to be visualized and edited, the `WorkflowItemsPresenter` also enables collection-oriented actions, such as inserting an item at a given index in the collection, deleting an item from the collection, and moving an item from one index to another. `WorkflowItemsPresenter` also handles combined actions, such as dragging between the various presenters and allowing that edit to occur in a single, undoable action.Use <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowItemPresenter> to present a single object on a design surface.
For an example of the WorkflowItemsPresenter in use, see the [Custom Composite Designers - Workflow Items Presenter](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) sample.
## Examples The following sample code shows how you can build a designer for the Parallel activity. Note the binding to ModelItem.Branches for the Items.
``` <sap:ActivityDesigner x:Class="customActivityDesigners.CustomParallelDesigner" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:sap="clr-namespace:System.Activities.Presentation;assembly=System.Activities.Presentation" xmlns:sa="clr-namespace:System.Activities;assembly=System.Activities" xmlns:sapv="clr-namespace:System.Activities.Presentation.View;assembly=System.Activities.Presentation"> <Grid> <StackPanel> <Label>Custom Parallel Designer</Label> <TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=ModelItem.Branches.Count, StringFormat=Branches: {0}}" /> <sap:WorkflowItemsPresenter Items="{Binding Path=ModelItem.Branches}" AllowedItemType="{x:Type sa:Activity }" HintText="Place Activities Here" Margin="20,0,0,0"> <sap:WorkflowItemsPresenter.ItemsPanel> <ItemsPanelTemplate> <StackPanel Orientation="Vertical" /> </ItemsPanelTemplate> </sap:WorkflowItemsPresenter.ItemsPanel> <sap:WorkflowItemsPresenter.SpacerTemplate> <DataTemplate> <Rectangle Width="80" Height="5" Fill="Black" /> </DataTemplate> </sap:WorkflowItemsPresenter.SpacerTemplate> </sap:WorkflowItemsPresenter> </StackPanel> </Grid> </sap:ActivityDesigner> ```
[!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty ItemsPanelProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowItemsPresenter.ItemsPanel%2A> dependency property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By providing a custom panel template, you can customize and control the layout of the contained items. The default <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.WorkflowItemsPresenter.ItemsPanel%2A> is based on a vertically oriented `StackPanel`. As an illustration, the `ItemsPanel` for the designer of <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Parallel> activities is based on a horizontally oriented `StackPanel`.
## Examples The following example in XAML shows the `ItemsPanel` for the designer of <xref:System.Activities.Statements.Parallel> activities that is based on a horizontally oriented `StackPanel`.
```
<sad:WorkflowItemsPresenter.ItemsPanel> <ItemsPanelTemplate> <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" HorizontalAlignment="Center" x:Name="ItemsPanel"/> </ItemsPanelTemplate> </sad:WorkflowItemsPresenter.ItemsPanel>
```
